page.title: 03New Costessey
page.content:
New Costessey started developing between the two World Wars. People came as squatters, and between the more modern replacement bungalows and houses you can still see an occasional wooden shack, or even a converted railway carriage. A lot of more orderly development has taken place since the Second World War.
Recently, a large modern council housing scheme has replaced land formerly covered with 'prefabs' erected as 'temporary' housing in the late 1940s. A little more land will become available when some structurally unsound 'Airey' houses are demolished.
